node.kTAG_DESCRIPTION: This represents the default ontology, it defines all the elements that are used to build the ontology itself.
This represents the default namespace, it groups all identifiers which are used internally by the ontology.
This is the collection of all default attributes, these attributes are the properties of the internal objects of this ontology engine.
This is the collection of all default predicates, these represent the required predicates for building the ontology.
This is the collection of all default enumerated sets, these represent the required controlled vocabulary that manages the ontology.
This group of attributes allows querying ontology component collections by identifier or synonym.
This group of attributes allows cross referencing terms, nodes, edges and tags. These references are not implemented as relationships, but as object properties.
This group of attributes provide a qualification and formal function to the ontology objects, they provide the rules of the behaviour of terms, nodes, edges and tags.
This group of attributes describe and name the hosting objects, they provide a means to illustrate and provide further details on objects and their context.
This group of attributes are used to reference or name the authors or origin of the elements of the ontology.
This group of attributes provide status information about the outcome of an event or state information on an object.
This group of enumerated sets covers the data types that the ontology handles.
This controlled vocabulary collects all the categories that define the kind of an ontology component.
This enumerated set describes the status level or severity of an event's outcome.
This enumerated set represents the standard set of operators which can be used to query data containers.
These represent the default primitive data types.
These represent the default structured data types.
These represent the default enumerated data types.
These represent the default cardinality types.
These represent the default relationship types.
